users.description: Climate & envirotweeting

tweets.text: Just to remind you all that just 24 hours ago the @EnvAgency admitted it will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/Cu3VPjycTa

Day Nine.
The pollution is STILL emanating from Furness Vale Marina, stretching over a mile to New Mills. The boom at Bridge 29 isn't working and the polluting waste oil is just as bad as it was a week ago. Why is the slick still not being stopped at Bridge 30? @CanalRiverTrust https://t.co/9lxlWtbhQe

Our fisheries enforcement officers are out and about in the Rugeley area #Staffordshire, checking fishing licences. 

It‚Äôs easy to buy a rod #fishing licence online: https://t.co/f5iTBUKpsS

#GetFishing https://t.co/DskpIvVsaM

tweets.text:
Are you signed up to receive @EnvAgency #floodwarnings ?? Find out more about #floodrisk on @TheFloodHub here https://t.co/wCOCRwuHIu

#floodaware #resilience https://t.co/4lFGsVMylN

@stu_hem @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Yep, incident response is now located in Sheffield. It used to be regional so the call handlers had a decent area knowledge, esp recurring issues. 

EA needs more local officers, they've always been stretched, even worse these days.

@360wastesupport @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Yes first call made wasn‚Äôt bothered the person who called me back was and was concerned about it being diesel as this was deemed more serious. Think original was a call centre and second was local as she knew area I was describing

urls.title: Climate crisis hitting 'worst case scenarios', warns Environment Agency
urls.description: Sir James Bevan says extreme flooding in UK indicates urgent need for change if humanity is to survive

tweets.text:
"Our thinking needs to change faster than the climate. And... our response needs to match the scale of the challenge.‚Äù 

- @JamesBevanEA, Chief Executive of @EnvAgency 
https://t.co/KRC2cvTjQn
@Lucy_Wilkins1 @EnvAgency https://t.co/s9jRYpnwNZ
@stu_hem @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Did you mention this? Dead fish were the trigger words when I was at the EA investigating pollutions back in the day.

There are currently a number of flood warnings and flood alerts in place in Cumbria. 
To keep up to date with the latest warnings visit - https://t.co/hC6Mnvkt1B

üåßÔ∏èRain is forecasted to continue today, take care if you are driving. 

@EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/Glayd72tVF

The @EnvAgency offers a free #flood warning service that enables people in flood warning areas to receive #flood alerts and warnings by telephone, text and email, even if you are not at home when they are sentüíß. 

Check if you're eligible by following the instructions below ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/go7pU41Vd3

@Feargal_Sharkey @suesustainable @EnvAgency It's bizarre. This is from 2018. From A Green Future: Our 25 Year Plan to Improve the Enviroment. Are our rivers really cleaner than 50 years ago? https://t.co/X5mJGwfubn
@360wastesupport @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency No but the fish were rising as never seen before all along the stretch which I took as being distressed
@stu_hem @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Bloomin' 'eck, that's a bad one. Did you see any dead fish?

@360wastesupport @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Definitely diesel and the EA stated that it was more than likely coming from Roecliffe industrial park as it was responsible for 2 previous spillages constant smell of diesel this was for approx 1 .5 miles which I walked

Is this true @Amazon‚ùìüëá

"Amazon received intense scrutiny after a number of workers accused the company of failing to provide safe conditions for warehouse employees"

üó£Ô∏è@East_Riding Would you like a consignment of sand to help with the #Melton planning app‚ùì

@saveferriby2020 https://t.co/kOA3ACGymO

urls.title: Am I at Risk? | The Flood Hub
urls.description: 1 in 6 properties in England are at risk of flooding from rivers, sea and surface water, with many others susceptible to various sources of flooding. This number is only set to increase due to climate change, making the need for you as a property owner to check your own risk ever more important. A variety of information is available to help you check your flood risk, from online data maps to risk management information, giving you a head start to prepare your property for potential flooding.

Are you signed up to receive @EnvAgency #floodwarnings ?? Find out more about #floodrisk on @TheFloodHub here https://t.co/wCOCRwuHIu

#floodaware #resilience https://t.co/4lFGsVMylN

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Reported this pollution on river Ure Yorkshire said they would look into it over 2 hours later get a call saying where is it and they would get someone to look later that day the smell was giving me headache it was so bad. Not heard a thing since https://t.co/5N1mU4paFv

The @EnvAgencyYNE  #SheafScreen in #Sheffield is coming along nicely.

Most of the major civils works are now complete and control panels installed, next steps are the debris grabs, electrical wiring, welfare provision and the final user testing. 

Due for completion mid 2021. https://t.co/w70e6NwrdI

A wet 24 hours in #Cumbria üå®Ô∏è. Several raingauges over 100mm and it's still raining üå®Ô∏è! Pleasing again that all our critical #Hydrometry raingauges appear to be working well üå®Ô∏èüòä @EnvAgencyNW @metoffice @metofficeNWEng https://t.co/ZkmK5pTbs7

@FoxesAfloat @CanalRiverTrust @Edwina_Currie @robertlargan @EnvAgency @Natures_Voice If the source  has been found ,is there any action been put into place to stop any further pollution at the culprit
